text: Alright, the Bitcamp competition just kicked off—super exciting
We all sat down together and pulled up the list of challenges.
There were so many options, so we decided to focus on the ones that sparked
We started with the public health challenge
It seemed really relevant and impactful.
Then we jumped over to the finance challenge from Capital One
They had this Nessie API we could potentially use.
We played around with some ideas, even considered doing something with machine learning.
One idea was to simulate signal strength from nearby cell towers using ML.
We skimmed a couple research papers on signal analysis to see if the idea had
It sounded cool, but honestly, we couldn’t find enough data to train a proper model.
So that idea kind of fizzled out, and we decided to pivot.
Then Narain randomly mentioned Cloudforce, which reminded us of Salesforce.
That actually led us down a rabbit hole—what does Salesforce really do?
Turns out, they’re all about CRMs and helping businesses manage relationships.
That’s when it clicked—what if we built a CRM, but just for business meetings?
We figured every team has meetings, but organizing outcomes and follow-ups is messy.
And that’s how BizCamp was born
It’s our take on streamlining meeting management.
We started thinking of smart features like automated transcripts and action item tracking.
The idea was to use AI to make meetings more productive, not just recorded.
We talked about checklists, summaries, and even concept maps generated from transcripts.
The project felt like a perfect mix—solving a real problem and building something ambitious.
And it came together naturally, just from bouncing ideas and being open to pivoting when needed.
